title: AI-Based Real-Time Classroom Interaction Analysis and Optimization Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Theoretical foundations in mathematics education and Project-Based Learning (PBL) experience, basic understanding of AI technology
context.additional_context: Real-time interaction data analysis using AI tools in BYOD environments and improvement of instructional strategies

learning_goals: Learners can classify classroom interaction patterns (student-teacher, student-student, student-object, and no interaction) with over 90% accuracy using an AI-based interaction tracking system.
Learners can analyze real-time interaction data and adjust immediate instructional strategies at least three times during a lesson.
Learners can propose at least one improvement plan for PBL (Problem-Based Learning) activity design based on one week of interaction logs.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
